113.content:
It was the first day of school, and Hermione was beat. She felt like she had been running from class to class all day. She never imagined that the school could be so big. It looks much smaller in the brochure, she thought. by the time she made it back to Gryffindor tower, her feet were killing her. She kicked off her shoes and dropped down into one of the chairs in front of the fire. She scanned the area for something to prop her feet on, but didn't see anything.

A few moments later Harry ambled through the door, dropped his books, and walked over to join her.

"How are you, Hermione?"
"I'd be a lot better if I could prop my feet up."
"Don't they have any stools around here?" he asked looking around the room.
"No. I've already looked. You would think that they would, wouldn't you?"

She pulled one of her feet up into her lap and tried to rub some of the soreness out of it.

"Let me help you with that," said Harry.
"Thanks."

When harry knelt at her feet, she took her wand from her pocked and whispered "stulio". Harry looked up at her in surprise before he begun to change.

Harry felt his insides beginning to creak and whir, much like the manner in which Uncle Vernon's car used to act up every morning he took it to work. In a matter of seconds, he felt his feet elongate and harden beyond restitution, his body contort and twist in ways he didn't think possible, till finally he stopped with his face looking up at what seemed to be the headrest of a recliner yet he knew it was his feet. Hermione has turned me into a recliner! Harry thought to himself.

" Funny...I expected you to turn into a footstool." exclaimed Hermione, interrupting Harry's train of thought, while climbing on to her new maroon recliner as she examined her wand and ran her fingers through her hair wondering what had gone wrong.

Meanwhile Harry was unsuccessfully trying to call for help as he felt Hermione climb on him and sit on what felt like his stomach, he saw her sink a little into him and then stretch her feet out unknowingly rubbing them into what was his face.

"This is really great Harry, you even match the upholstery in the common room" said Hermione, secretly wishing she could repeat this in transfiguration class, and maybe make it so she could see where his face was now.

Stretching her feet, she began glancing through the Daily Prophet reading interesting anecdotes aloud to Harry as the fire kept crackling.

114.content:
Hermione Granger was currently alone in the Gryffindor common room reading her favorite book, “Hogwarts, A History”. However, she couldn’t help but be sad; Hermione has been at Hogwarts for one full month and she has yet to make a real friend. As she was thinking on this, she heard someone come in the Common Room. She turned and saw it was Harry Potter, who she met on the train to Hogwarts but hadn’t really talked to since then since he was always with Ron Weasley, who didn’t like her at all. Hermione then deiced to get back to her book. She didn’t notice that Harry was walking towards her.
“Hermione, can I ask you something?” asked Harry.
“What, Harry? I’m in the middle of reading my favorite book”, replied Hermione.
“I was wondering if you could help me with my homework. I-“, started Harry.
“Is that all I’m needed for?!” Hermione began to yell. “Everyone doesn’t want to get to know me, to be my friend, but as soon as they need help with homework, they come to me as if we were friends! Well, I’m sick of it. I’ll help you, but in return, you’re going to do something for me, got it?!”
Harry was scared by this point. “Y-yes Ma’am”
“Ma’am? I’ve never been called that before. Okay, from now on, you don’t call me by my first name; it’s way too informal for you.”
“Yes, Ma’am”, Harry replied immediately. He didn’t understand why he was following her orders so easily. It felt so natural.
“Okay then. Let’s get started on that homework”, said a thinking Hermione. She felt a power rush when Harry called her ma’am and agreed to be more formal with how he calls her. With some gentle pushing, Hermione was thinking she could have Harry be her willing slave in no time at all. Who needs friends when you can have the Boy-Who-Lived as your obedient slave?
After about an hour, Harry’s homework was done.
“Thank you so much, Miss Granger! You’re a lifesaver!” replied Harry.
“You called me Miss Granger this time” said a surprised and happy Hermione.
“Well you told me not to call you by your first name”, said Harry although it made him think. Why exactly was he following her orders so easily? Why did it please him so much to follow such a simple order from her?
“I see”, said a very excited Hermione. “Now as for our agreement, you must do something for me.”
“What is it, Miss Granger?”

115.content:
Hermione came into the compartment where Ron and Harry were sat eating sweets together. "Has anyone seen a toad? A boy called Neville has lost one" she asked, almost automatically, with out even asking their names first. They declined but Hermione noticed that one of the boys' the red headed one had his wand out.

"Are you doing magic?" she asked, thinking the answer was perfectly obvious "let's see then?" Her tone suddenly sounded slightly more interested, slightly less bored as she took a seat next to Ron. She was grateful for the opportunity to sit down, her feet were a little sore after all the walking she had been required to undertake, getting to the train on time.

"Sunshine, daises, butter mellow. Turn this stupid fat rat yellow" he intoned, waving his wand frantically in the direction of the rat that she assumed was his pet.

"Is that a real spell, well it's not very good is it. I've only tried a few simple spells myself but they've all worked for me." She glanced at the boy opposite, she noticed was wearing glasses.

"Example" she pointed her wand at him "Ocular Reparo"

The dark haired boy's glasses immediately mended themselves, he removed them for a moment, an astonished expression on his face, and she noticed a scar on his forehead in the shape of a lightning bolt."

"Holy cricket! You're Harry Potter. She studied him a little more then stated "I'm Hermione Granger." Just as she said this she felt a sudden twinge in her foot,, If Harry was the great hero he was reputed to be perhaps he wouldn't mind helping her with.... but how to?....

She dropped her wand on the floor, in a way that made it look like it was accidental, and a gently swing of her left foot kicked it under her chair "Drat, I dropped it" she gasped, giving Harry a questioning glance.

"Allow me" Harry invited, ever the hero. Of course she would allow him, this was her plan.

She lifted her feet up into the air, allowing Harry room to reach under her seat. The wand seemed to be resting against the back wall. He leaned forward, grasped the wand and then raised his hand to pass it to her. She took her wand back and looked back down at him.

"Thanks Harry, you are a useful boy to have around" she remarked, then then lowered her feet, allowing them to come to rest upon his back.
"Especially when I need to rest my aching feet" she continued, as she relaxed.

If you were really his friend, you would've kept quiet after Harry just said that it was fine that I'm resting my feet on him." said Hermione very fast.

"Is that true, Ron? Were you really after my money? Did you really only see me as the Boy-Who-Lived? If you don't see me as just Harry like Hermione here, then get out."

1341.content:
After a few minutes, Harry and Hermione eventually shrugged off the suspicion that something would happen to him, continuing down Diagon Alley as if they hadn't just had their discussion on him becoming her pet. They continued onward, buying books, and Hermione began her care for him with much gusto, helping herself to his money as they purchased supplies. At first, Harry gave her a weird look, but she simply smiled and batted her eyes at him, making him stop his look. He was unsure of what would happen if he said something, but decided to anyways.

"Hermione, this is my money. I thought you still had some of your own..."

"Oh, Harry. It IS my money. Since you're mine, everything you had is mine, too. You didn't pay attention to math, did you? Ever hear of the transitive property?"

"Well, it works with numbers, but I'm not sure-"

"That's why you shouldn't think, Harry."

She smiled and happily continued spending his money, then started walking away, urging Harry to follow her. However, Harry was beginning to feel ill, and ran for the bathroom nearest him, barely making it before he felt his clothes slowly hang from him. He threw up in the sink as Hermione made it into the bathroom behind him. She smiled and nodded as he felt the world spin. He focused on a point in the sink, trying not to pass out, and noted that the vomit wasn't vomit. It was dark brown, thick, and sticky, like the blob monsters you see in old horror movies. It smelled horrible, and it made him feel sicker. Hermione giggled behind him as he felt himself falling, then blacked out.

Harry woke up on a strange surface, kinda itchy, but soft, with a hard, cold surface below it. He felt less ill, but still took to a coughing fit, dry heaving as his belly burned. He couldn't open his eyes, feeling too weak to even try. All he heard was a loud rustling, and a roar of people outside the room he was in. He heard a rumble as curled up to protect his ears, then he heard a deafening sound, and his hearing returned to normal. He whimpered from the pain, and tried to sit up.

"Harry? Are you okay?"

He groaned and tried to talk, barely managing the words, "I'm... Not... Sure..." Hermione giggled, then there was shuffling,and the padding of something soft on hard floor. He rubbed his eyes and then slowly forced them open, the dull blur of his vision slowly clearing as he woke. His first sight was of a giant Hermione standing over him, smiling. She lifted a foot, which was now bare, and dropped it on him, pressing him into the floor with her soft sole. Harry grunted and squirmed, making Hermione giggle with a little groan at the end. The question was, was Hermione mad at Harry, or was she forgiving?

What she was considering was the spell she had put on her feet, and the reason why she had.

Parvati. She was the reason for the simple enchantment.  Hermione was always studying in the common room, she found that even with the near constant hubbub of Her housemates, and even the ever ongoing pranks of those confounded Weasely twins, she concentrated better there than nearly anywhere else in the entire school.  And always she sat in the same comfy chair near the fire. and always she took her shoes off, she was nothing if not a creature of habit, and she found that if her feet were less restricted she concentrated better, though she didn't know why.  

The only problem with this arrangment (besides people in general thinking her odd for studying at all) was that her feet gave off a rather noticeable stench.  And for some reason or another (Hermione wasn't one to read emotions or motives very well) she would not leave Hermione alone about the stink of her feet, every comment there was to be made on the subject, and Parvati Patil would there to make it.  It was this endless teasing that drove Hermione to the library to find a solution.

From now on She smiled to herself Parvati will have find something else about me to tease. 


As Hermione was realizing this, she was also beginning to realize that Harry was much too close for the charm to to be working properly.  Not to say that it wasn't working, more as though it was working in overdrive.  Harry was much too close, where a normal distance away would make the smell bearable and perhaps even slightly pleasent, as she was now finding out, if a person got up close and personal with her feet, they apparently became smitten with the smell, as Harry was so obviously demonstrating with his antics under the table.

Hermione sat quietly on the teacher's desk of an empty classroom, waiting for her prey to arrive. Soon, Parvati Patil would be her her slave and take place (literally) at Hermione's feet. The plan was really quite simple; Harry would isolate Parvati from her friend Lavender and bring her to the classroom. As a safety precaution, she was wearing Harry's invisibility cloak and had cast several silencing charms around the room to prevent anyone from overhearing the enslavement. Furthermore, she was wearing her thickest stockings and shoes, drastically increasing the strength of her foot odor.

That was the worst part of this whole plan, keeping those horrible tings on her feet. She desperately wanted to free her feet and wiggle her toes on the fresh air, but that risked the smell warning Parvati before they were ready, defeating the whole purpose of the invisibility cloak in the first place. Hermione's only option was to endure the wait. Fortunately, she didn't have to wait long.

"So, Harry," said Parvati, "what did you want to talk to me about?"

Harry smiled. "Follow me," he told her, leading her to the desk right where Hermione was sitting, indicating for her to sit down. Just as they planned.

He entered the room and looked around. It was completely empty.
"Lay in the middle on the floor" Hermione said in her usually bossy tone
"Umm why?" He asked, raising his eyebrows
"Just do it!" She yelled
"The floor looks dirty." He said, unsure of why she wanted him to do this.
Hermione pointed her wand at Harry and muttered something. Harry's mind went blank as an Imperious curse much stronger than he had ever experienced took over. He found him self walking quickly into the center of the room and laid down. Chains sprung out of the floor and bound him there as a chair appeared over his chest, the front legs under each of his arms. Hermione removed the curse and walked slowly toward him.
"What's going on?!" He asked, now frightened
Hermione sat on the chair with one leg on each side of Harry's head, ignoring his words. She started to undo the laces on one of her shoes.
"What are you doing?" Harry asked, confused
Hermione pointed her wand at Harry again and said
"Silencio"
Harry opened and closed his mouth, trying to speak with no sound coming out. Hermione had now removed both of her shoes and was in her socks. The smell wafted over Harry and he tried to move his head away but only managed to turn his face toward one of Hermione's socked feet. She smiled and pushed his face back so he was looking into her face.
"Ready to try my new spell?" She said, grinning evilly
Harry shook his head violently and looked into her eyes with a pleading expression. She ignored him and pointer her wand at him for a third time.
"Nasalentio" she said
Instantly, Harry's nose burned. His sense of smell was magnified ten times more sensitive than usual. Hermione smiled at the expression on his face, then lifted her foot and placed it on his face. He tried to move his head away but she held him strongly.
"Smell!" She yelled, grinding his head into the ground.
He reluctantly took a breath through his nose and the stench of her feet filled his brain and he almost vomited. She smiled as he suffered under her foot and covered his face with both her feet, blocking his face from view completely. She sighed and produced a book from inside her robes, reading silently as Harry breathed the only air that was available to him; the thick stinky air from between her socked toes.

153.title: 7th Year

He's too proud to beg - this pisses her off!
Something else...
1532.content:
For the next few days after Ron left, the resentment that was burning inside Hermione was making her increasingly short of patience with Harry. How could he let his best friend - her boyfriend - just leave like that? To think, she once considered Harry Potter to be a good, strong leader. Now she saw him as a complete waste of space!

With no way to contact Ron, Hermione came to a decision that just made sense. She had to make Harry realise that he had made a mistake in fighting with her boyfriend and forcing him to leave. Then she would either walk away, or make him suffer for his foolish mistakes...

"I can't believe he would just leave like that," Harry said grimly while they ate a spartan lunch of bread and whatever fruit she had managed to procure.

"Leaving just like that. Seriously, Harry," Hermione's voice was low and dangerous, catching him somewhat off guard.

"You know what I mean - he was selfish. Selfish and-"

"Look. I was going to wait for a more opportune time to say this, but I can't bear your complete and utter nonsense for even another second!" Hermione thundered, standing up, her eyes full of anger and hatred for her companion. "YOU forced him to leave Harry - no one but you!"

And with that she shot her hand out, connecting hard with his cheek and emitting a slapping sound. Both teenagers gasped in surprise; Hermione herself couldn't quite believe what she had done! It reminded her of the time she had struck Draco Malfoy back in the third year, though that was a feeling of sheer satisfaction. This was more complicated.

"If you want me to apologise," Harry said quietly, a look of shock still plastered on his face. "Then I can't. He-"

SMACK! This time she full on punched him in the nose, causing him to cry out in pain and slump to the floor. Clutching at his nose and feeling the hot liquid sensation of blood begin to gush from it, Harry stared up at her with genuine fear. In the seven years he had known her, he had never seen her like this!

"Listen to me, you selfish ego-centric idiot! He is my boyfriend - someone who I love and care about and you treated him like dirt! Did you think I would just forgive you? I was going to leave the next day, until I realised that it would be too dangerous to find him! You need to pay for what you've done - for all the crap you've put me through in the last seven years included! The number of times I've risked my life for you? I've been paralysed, turned into a cat...gone to hell and back for you! Enough is enough!" She roared at him.

"Please...please don't go!" Harry called up at her, blood still pouring from her nose. Although he was frustrated with her outburst, he knew deep down that he needed her. He wouldn't last more than a couple of days without her!

"Beg me - beg me to stay then we'll see!" Hermione said disdainfully, her eyes still sparking with fury.

Harry gulped; was he really going to swallow his pride in order to get his friend to stay...?
1532.title: Hermione lets her anger out!

15321.content:
He couldn't do this alone. He had to have Hermione with him! Swallowing his pride he took a breath and began to beg.

"Please Hermione, please stay. I'm begging you I can't do this alone."

Hermione looked at him with disdain. This was the one who could take down the Dark Lord?

"If you're going to beg Harry beg properly!"

"W-what do you mean? I don't understand."

Hermione lashed out, this time instead of going for his face she stepped in and kneed him hard in the balls. Harry gave a pathetic high pitched screech and fell to his knees clutching his manhood.

"There you go, now you may continue." Hermione hastily explained and took a seat on one of the chairs in the tent. Harry was on his knees before her as she regally crossed her legs. The pain rendered him speechless for several moments. When he could breathe properly he looked up at Hermione and saw the rage still dancing in her eyes.

"Please Hermione I beg you. You are the smartest witch of our generation! Please I'm on my knees begging for your help. I'll do anything!"

A smirk graced Hermione's pretty face. "Oh? Anything?"

Harry sensing hope nodded quickly, "Yes just please stay with me. Don't make me try to do this alone."

Hermione stared down at the Boy-Who-Lived.

"All right if you really will do anything then you can begin making all of this up to me by..."
